intro: Ericoides nivenii, commonly known as the Niven's heath, is a rare and specialized plant species belonging to the Ericaceae family. It is characterized by its small, evergreen leaves and compact, shrub-like growth habit. This plant is typically found in acidic, nutrient-poor soils, often in heathland or moorland environments. Ericoides nivenii has adapted to thrive in cool, moist climates with limited sunlight. Its flowers, which are usually pink or white, bloom in late spring or early summer, adding a delicate touch to its natural habitat.
